[[Application security]]
[[Security management|Security Management]]
[[Big data|Big Data]] | products = [[Application firewall|Multi-Protocol Information Assurance Firewall]], [[SCADA|Multi-Protocol SCADA/ICS Firewall]], [[Security management|Data Security Management]] | homepage = [http://www.bayshorenetworks.com/ BayshoreNetworks.com] }}'''Bayshore Networks''' is a privately held information assurance and security technology company, founded in New York, NY in 2002 by CEO Francis Cianfrocca. The Company is majority-owned by its founders and employees, with minority investment from senior partners at a multi-billion-dollar hedge fund.{{cite web|url=https://gust.com/c/bayshore_networks_inc|title=Bayshore Networks Inc.}} The company produces high-end, multi-protocol, behavior-based [[application layer|Layer 7]] [[information assurance]] [[application firewall]]s which secure both internet-facing applications and intranet enterprise applications behind the [[DMZ (computing)|DMZ]], as well as blocking insider attacks/[[Advanced Persistent Threat|APTs]]. == Products and Technology == Bayshore Networks' primary industry focus is in government, military/defense, commercial enterprise, and ICS/critical infrastructure.{{cite web|url=http://www.networkworld.com/news/tech/2012/100212-security-response-262977.html?page=1|title=In security response, practice makes perfect|publisher=NetworkWorld|author= Sean Martin|date=October 02, 2012 )}} Products are deployed in the network core infrastructure, exercising [[Granularity#Computing|fine-grained]] security policy enforcement developed through [[Heuristic analysis|heuristic behavioral analysis]] and application [[Software configuration management|base-lining]].{{cite web|url=https://www.451research.com/report-short?entityId=71901|title=Bayshore Networks joins forces with BAE Systems for advanced security|publisher=451 Research|author= Wendy Nather, Security Research Director|date=5 Apr, 2012 (paid access)}} The technology utilizes a "pervasive network presence" deployment model ("secure network fabric") {{cite web|url=http://www.networkworld.com/newsletters/techexec/2012/091412bestpractices.html?page=2|title=Mitigating advanced persistent threats within industrial and critical infrastructure environments|publisher=NetworkWorld|author= Brian Musthaler|date=September 13, 2012 }} which performs full-stream analysis on all links within a complex application structure, including the links to secondary application tiers (a critical element in defending against [[Advanced persistent threat|advanced persistent threats or APTs]]), and is designed to protect against a variety of known attack types including the [[OWASP]] Top Ten risks.{{cite web | url = https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Category:OWASP_Top_Ten_Project|title = ''OWASP Top 10 for 2010''}} The company is included in the OWASP-recognized list of Web Application Firewalls.{{cite web | url = http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Web_Application_Firewall | title = ''Web Application Firewall - OWASP''}} Product categories include a [[OSI model|multi-layer]], [[Internet Protocol Suite|multi-protocol]] information firewall (deployed as either a [[Computer appliance|hard appliance]], a [[software appliance|soft appliance]], or a [[virtual machine]] such as a [[VMware]] {{cite web|url=http://www.vmware.com/appliances/directory/303103|title=''VMware virtual appliances''}} appliance) as well as a multi-[http://www.isa.org/journals/intech/TP04ISA048.pdf ICS protocol] [[SCADA]] information assurance firewall, and a [[Security management|real-time situational awareness]] firewall management console. ==See also== *[[Application layer firewall|Application Layer Firewall]] *[[Application security|Application Security]] *[[Information assurance|Information Assurance]] *[[Information assurance firewall|Information Assurance Firewall]] *[[OSI model|Open Systems Interconnection model]] *[[Security management|Data Security Management]]
